definitions.text: the particular auditory effect produced by a given cause
examples: the sound of rain on the roof

definitions.text: the subjective sensation of hearing something
examples: he strained to hear the faint sounds

definitions.text: mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium
examples: falling trees make a sound in the forest even when no one is there to hear them

definitions.text: the sudden occurrence of an audible event
the audible part of a transmitted signal
examples: they always raise the audio for commercials

definitions.text: (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
a narrow channel of the sea joining two larger bodies of water
a large ocean inlet or deep bay
examples: the main body of the sound ran parallel to the coast

definitions.text: appear in a certain way
make a certain noise or sound
give off a certain sound or sounds
announce by means of a sound
utter with vibrating vocal chords
cause to sound
measure the depth of (a body of water) with a sounding line
financially secure and safe
exercising or showing good judgment
examples: the healthy attitude of French laws
healthy relations between labor and management
a sound approach to the problem
no sound explanation for his decision

definitions.text: in good condition; free from defect or damage or decay
in excellent physical condition
examples: I still have one good leg
a sound mind in a sound body

definitions.text: logically valid
having legal efficacy or force
examples: a sound title to the property

definitions.text: free from moral defect
(of sleep) deep and complete
thorough
